text: William John Macquorn Rankine (born July 5, 1820 in Edinburgh â€“ died December 24, 1872 in Glasgow) was a Scottish physicist and engineer. He developed the Rankine scale. He made many important contributions to the thermodynamics. His manuals of engineering science and practice were used for many decades after their publication, in the 1850s and 1860s. == Publications == === Books === * Manual of Applied Mechanics, (1858) * Manual of the Steam Engine and Other Prime Movers, (1859) * Manual of Civil Engineering, (1861) * Shipbuilding, theoretical and practical, (1866) * Manual of Machinery and Millwork, (1869) Category:1820 births Category:1872 deaths Category:British civil engineers Category:Scientists from Edinburgh Category:Scottish physicists Category:British mechanical engineers
title: William John Macquorn Rankine
